text: Old Bridge Township, New Jersey is a township of New Jersey. ==Notable people== People who were born in, residents of, or otherwise closely associated with Old Bridge Township include: * Josh Ansley, bass player for Streetlight Manifesto and Catch 22.Staff. "Hurt so good" , Home News Tribune, March 14, 2008. Accessed February 7, 2011. "Spatola and Ansley (bass) both grew up in Old Bridge and went to shows and performed at the former Birch Hill Night Club in the township..." * T. Frank Appleby (1864–1924), represented New Jersey's 3rd congressional district in the United States House of Representatives from 1921 to 1923.Theodore Frank Appleby, Biographical Directory of the United States Congress. Accessed August 30, 2007. * Louis Consalvo (born 1958), reputed soldier in the DeCavalcante crime family.Press Release , United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, October 19, 2000. Accessed February 7, 2011. * Junot Diaz (born 1968), Pulitzer Prize-winning novelist.Tejada, Miguel Cruz. "Junot Díaz dice “en RD hay muchos quirinos”; escribirá obra inspirada en caso" , El Nuevo Diario (Dominican Republic), August 11, 2008. Accessed August 25, 2008. "Hizo el bachillerato en el Cedar Ridge High School de Old Bridge, Nueva Jersey, en 1987, y se licenció en inglés en la Universidad Rutgers (1992), e hizo un Master of Fine Arts en la Universidad de Cornell." * Colleen Fitzpatrick (born 1969), a pop music artist, dancer and actress, better known by her stage name, Vitamin C."OFF THE RECORD: A Fine New Jersey 'Colleen'" , Irish Voice, May 1, 2001. Accessed August 10, 2007. "COLLEEN Fitzpatrick, a comely lass from Old Bridge, New Jersey, is the media dynamo behind the concept known as Vitamin C." * Caren Lissner (born 1972), novelist.Celano, Claire Marie. "Young author offers tips to audience at workshop: Caren Lissner says love of writing should be first ingredient toward success" , News Transcript, July 30, 2003. Accessed August 25, 2008. "Lissner, 31, grew up in Freehold Township and attended the Laura Donovan School and the Barkalow Middle School.... She later graduated from high school in Old Bridge." * Brian O'Halloran (born 1969), actor. Appeared in Clerks and Clerks 2.Cahillane, Kevin. "For the Stars of ‘Clerks,’ It’s Take Two", The New York Times, July 14, 2006. Accessed June 8, 2008. "Mr. O’Halloran, a resident of Old Bridge since age 13, has not had to go the McJob route." * Jodi Lyn O'Keefe (born 1978), actress."Jodi Lyn O'Keefe about Hallmark Movie Class", Official Site Jodi Lyn O'Keefe. Accessed November 6, 2010. * Overkill, thrash metal band. * Tab Ramos (born 1966), retired soccer midfielder.Mifflin, Lawrie. "Doing a Star Turn for the Home Team, at Last", The New York Times, August 18, 1996. Accessed March 11, 2012. "Giants Stadium is a short trip up the turnpike from Old Bridge, where Mr. Ramos lives with his wife, Amy -- a former North Carolina State University soccer player like her husband -- and their 16-month-old son, Alex." * R. J. Allen (born 1990), soccer player for NYCFC. * George Rizzi (born 1951), guitarist and musical director of the 1960s pop/rock group The Happenings, whose hits include "See You In September" and "Go Away Little Girl".Galdden, Michelle. "Show benefits those with ALS, other illnesses" , Asbury Park Press, May 7, 2005. Accessed November 3, 2012, "'The idea is that the money is not earmarked just for research,' said George Rizzi of Old Bridge and a member of The Happenings." * Diane Ruggiero, screen writer for Veronica Mars.Weinraub, Bernard. "Jersey Girl Makes It Big, at Least on TV", The New York Times, June 20, 2000. Accessed November 25, 2012. "After years of struggling as a writer and working as a waitress and bartender in and around the working- and middle-class North Jersey towns North Arlington and East Rutherford, Ms. Ruggiero (ROUGE-ear-oh) has been plucked from obscurity to write and help produce a new autobiographical television comedy series, That's Life, on CBS." * Ed Sanicki (1923–1998), outfielder who played for the Philadelphia Phillies.Singerman, Philip. "FIELD OF DREAMS THIS BASEBALL SEASON, THESE THREE MEN SHARE LIFE IN THE MINOR LEAGUES. BUT THEIR SIGHTS ARE SET HIGHER:TWO IN THE FUTURE, ONE IN THE PAST." , Orlando Sentinel, August 11, 1985. Accessed February 15, 2011. "It's always that way for Oujo, 26, a native of Old Bridge N.J. now in his fifth season as a professional umpire... His next door neighbor Ed Sanicki a former major-league player with the Philadelphia Phillies told him that umpiring Little League games would be a much better way to earn extra money than working in a McDonald's..." * Donna Simpson (born 1967), Guinness World Record holder for largest mother.Rose, Lisa. "Once 600 pounds, mom from Old Bridge puts down the fork and turns off the webcam", The Star-Ledger, December 18, 2011. Accessed January 30, 2012. "A mother of two from Old Bridge became a tabloid phenomenon last year after saying she was proud of her 600-pound physique, and wouldn’t mind getting bigger. Donna Simpson capitalized on the notoriety that followed, as her internet modeling career took off and traffic increased on her website, where voyeurs could watch her eat on camera for $19 a month." * Shannon Sohn (born 1974), first helicopter reporter to earn a national Emmy Award.Smith, Jessica. "TV news reporter recalls how her career took off: OBHS grad became first helicopter reporter to win national Emmy" , Old Bridge Suburban, July 3, 2008. Accessed February 7, 2011. "OLD BRIDGE - Though Emmy Award-winning television reporter Shannon Sohn always has a "Plan B" in case things do not go her way, everything seems to have fallen into place quite nicely for her." * William H. Sutphin (1887–1972) represented from 1931-1943.William Halstead Sutphin, Biographical Directory of the United States Congress. Accessed August 30, 2007. ==Education== The Old Bridge Township Public Schools serve students in Kindergarten through twelfth grade. As of the 2023-24 school year, the district's 14 schools had an enrollment of 8,096 students and 670.5 classroom teachers (on an FTE basis), for a student–teacher ratio of 12.07:1.District information for Old Bridge Township School District, National Center for Education Statistics. Accessed September 7, 2024. Schools in the district (with 2023-24 enrollment data from the National Center for Education StatisticsSchool Data for the Old Bridge Township Public Schools, National Center for Education Statistics. Accessed September 7, 2024.) are eleven K-5 elementary schools — M. Scott Carpenter Elementary SchoolM. Scott Carpenter Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (226 students), Leroy Gordon Cooper Elementary SchoolLeroy Gordon Cooper Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (196), Virgil I. Grissom Elementary SchoolVirgil I. Grissom Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (182), Madison Park Elementary SchoolMadison Park Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (285), James A. McDivitt Elementary SchoolJames A. McDivitt Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. September 7, 2024. (532), Memorial Elementary SchoolMemorial Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (417), William A. Miller Elementary SchoolWilliam A. Miller Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. September 7, 2024. (332), Walter M. Schirra Elementary SchoolWalter M. Schirra Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. September 7, 2024. (269), Alan B. Shepard Elementary SchoolAlan B. Shepard Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (280), Southwood Elementary SchoolSouthwood Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (343) and Raymond E. Voorhees Elementary SchoolRaymond E. Voorhees Elementary School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (394) — both Jonas Salk Middle SchoolJonas Salk Middle School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (903) and Carl Sandburg Middle SchoolCarl Sandburg Middle School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. (981) for grades 6-8 and Old Bridge High SchoolOld Bridge High School, Old Bridge Township Public Schools. Accessed September 7, 2024. for grades 9-12 (2,707). ==References== ==Other websites== *Old Bridge Township Official Website *Old Bridge Township Public Schools * *School Data for the Old Bridge Township Public Schools, National Center for Education Statistics Category:Townships in New Jersey Category:Middlesex County, New Jersey
title: Old Bridge Township, New Jersey
